title: Convert to Exponential Form

title: Rewrite $$\frac{1}{9}$$ in terms of $$\frac{1}{3}$$
text: Since $$3^2=9$$, we can actually rewrite $$\frac{1}{9}$$ in terms of $$\frac{1}{3}$$. What is $$\frac{1}{9}$$ equal to in terms of $$\frac{1}{3}$$?
speech: Since  3 squared is equal to 9 , we can actually rewrite  1 ninth  in terms of  1 third . What is  1 ninth  equal to in terms of  1 third ?
pacedSpeech: equal to in terms of   1 third

title: Simplifying the Exponential
text: We note that $${\left(\frac{1}{x}\right)}^y=x^{\left(-y\right)}$$. How can we rewrite $$\frac{1}{32}={\left(\frac{1}{2}\right)}^5$$ in terms of powers of 2?
speech: We note that  parentheses 1 over x,  to the y-th is equal to x raised to the parentheses negative y  power . How can we rewrite  1 over 32 is equal to, parentheses 1 half  to the fifth  in terms of powers of 2?
pacedSpeech: We note that    1 over x,  to the y-th is equal to x raised to the  negative y  power
. How can we rewrite   1 over 32 is equal to,  1 half  to the fifth

title: Solve for $$x$$
text: Substitution $$3^{\left(-2\right)}$$ into the exponential equation we found before, we get $$3^x=3^{\left(-2\right)}$$. What is $$x$$?
speech: Substitution  3 raised to the parentheses negative 2  power  into the exponential equation we found before, we get  3 to the x-th is equal to 3 raised to the parentheses negative 2  power . What is  x ?
